sentence.Network_en: The letter was a mishmash of ill-fitting proposals taken from two different reform plans.

sentence.Network_en: According to local journalists, students and NGOs, the compromise is an awkward mishmash.
sentence.Network_cn: 中国记者 、 学生和非政府组织都认为, 双方妥协的结果是一份棘手的大杂烩.

why Microsoft product management let Network Access Protection grow up into the mishmash that exists ( at least in part ) today is unclear .为什么微软的产品管理部门容许网络接入保护发展成今天这种大杂烩的样子是无从知晓的。

RelatedPhrase.word: a mishmash of unrelated facts and figures

list.key: a mishmash of unrelated facts and figures
list.exp: 一堆互不相关的书和数字
list.abs: 一堆互不相关的书和数字 a mishmash of unrelated facts and figures 认不出自己的老友 misknow one's old friend 日本豆面酱 miso 厌婚症 misogamy 不合.

entry.tran: 杂乱的一堆;混杂物;大杂烩
entry.def: If you say that something is a mishmash, you are criticizing it because it is a confused mixture of different types of things.

example.ex: The letter was a mishmash of ill-fitting proposals taken from two different reform plans.
example.tran: 这封信乱七八糟地写到了一些风马牛不相及的提议，分别摘自两个不同的改革计划。

example.ex: ...a bizarre mishmash of colours and patterns.
example.tran: 色彩和图案的奇怪组合
